metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12695 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Open Connectivity Foundation UPnP specification before 2020-04-17 does not forbid the acceptance of a subscription request with a delivery URL on a different network segment than the fully qualified event-subscription URL, aka the CallStranger issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

wpagui - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm3
wpasupplicant - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gupnp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libupnp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
minidlna: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
wpa package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm3').
wpa package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm3').
